materials.raw_text: Bi: 20 g, Co: 40 g, Er: 240 g, Ru: 60 g

sourcing.instructions: Bi (Bismuth): Specialty metal suppliers, online chemical supply stores. Co (Cobalt): Metal suppliers, online chemical distributors. Er (Erbium): Rare earth metal suppliers, online chemical supply stores. Ru (Ruthenium): Specialty metal suppliers, online chemical distributors.
steps: Bi (Bismuth): Specialty metal suppliers, online chemical supply stores. Co (Cobalt): Metal suppliers, online chemical distributors. Er (Erbium): Rare earth metal suppliers, online chemical supply stores. Ru (Ruthenium): Specialty metal suppliers, online chemical distributors.

1. Measure out 20 g of Bi, 40 g of Co, 240 g of Er, and 60 g of Ru using a precision scale. 2. Place the Bi, Co, Er, and Ru in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a glass rod to stir the mixture thoroughly until a homogeneous powder is achieved. 4. Transfer the mixture to a mortar and pestle for finer grinding if necessary. 5. Ensure that the mixture is free of clumps and evenly mixed.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure out 20 g of Bi, 40 g of Co, 240 g of Er, and 60 g of Ru using a precision scale. 2. Place the Bi, Co, Er, and Ru in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a glass rod to stir the mixture thoroughly until a homogeneous powder is achieved. 4. Transfer the mixture to a mortar and pestle for finer grinding if necessary. 5. Ensure that the mixture is free of clumps and evenly mixed.

steps: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1200 °C. 2. Place the mixed powder into a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace once it has reached the desired temperature. 4. Maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure proper melting and alloy formation.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1200 °C. 2. Place the mixed powder into a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace once it has reached the desired temperature. 4. Maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure proper melting and alloy formation.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature. 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has cooled to avoid thermal shock to the crucible. 3. This process should take approximately 4-6 hours.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature. 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has cooled to avoid thermal shock to the crucible. 3. This process should take approximately 4-6 hours.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Allow the solid sample to sit at room temperature for an additional hour. 3. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 4. Sand the edges to remove any sharp points and achieve a smooth finish. 5. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability and prevent oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Allow the solid sample to sit at room temperature for an additional hour. 3. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 4. Sand the edges to remove any sharp points and achieve a smooth finish. 5. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability and prevent oxidation.
